story.storykicker: From being raped repeatedly by her husband to establishing her niche as a stuntwoman in Bollywood, Geeta Tandon is the living embodiment of a hero.
story.storybody:
If this doesn't make a case against marital rape, we don't know what will. This story does, however, make a case against a lot of other social evils we conveniently ignore on a daily basis.

Mother of two and Bollywood stuntwoman Geeta lived them every day, and has emerged from the dark to tell her tale--and what an inspiring one it is.

After losing her mother to fate at 10, Geeta was married off by the age of 15. Why? Societal pressure.

Diving into marriage with expectations of running her own life (finally), Geeta was met with servant-like treatment. Above all, "My mother-in-law told my husband he's an eunuch, since he couldn't handle a woman. She said, tear her clothes, rape her, let's see what her father does then."

Yes, that's the reality Geeta had to put up with. And it didn't stop after the birth of her first child, or second.

A video by Blush takes you through her story. But be warned, this is not for the faint-hearted.
